lexUnit.name: seat.v

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: FN: have the capacity for holding a number of seated individuals.

sentence.text: Despite their great size , the new cars only seated 56 , although their massive platforms could accommodate many standing passengers .
The two small cars seated only 32 inside , and it has been speculated that they were intended to draw the trailers during summer operation .
The vault bar seats approximately 55 persons and is more attractive to the younger drinkers because of its atmosphere and prices .
It is a great barn of a place which seats 5,000 but which that day was due to hold 2,500 .

Next to the gardens , there will be a sports and recreation arena seating up to 12,000 people , while brand new tennis facilities at the Oberhausen Tennis Club reflect Germany 's growing enthusiasm for the sport .
It seats approximately 180 persons for full silver service , and has been redecorated by Duchy throughout in traditional English style .
It also seated about 300 together with room for a choir of 215 .
It was used for plays and mimes and seated about 5000 people .
The dining room seats a maximum of 48 covers , which has tended to inhibit its use as a public restaurant during the peak season .
The public rooms include a restaurant capable of seating 100 diners , a residents ' lounge and a bar .
In a third-class carriage there are seven compartments , seating three a side , each fitted with electric bell push for attendant , and a lavatory at either end .
The Recital Room , which seats 220 , has since become established as an excellent venue for solo performances , recitals , chamber ensembles and jazz groups .
The four-wheel cars -- 62-64 -- were smaller , seated 66 , and had seven narrow full-drop windows in the saloon .
The original cars seated 69 , but the new one seated only 64 .
On our new ship Ecstasy , each restaurant seats 650 passengers and we two sittings of each meal at set meal times .
Her cockpit seated two , a pilot and a co-pilot , each in a standard zero-g web .
If demand is greater we can either book another bus or use the mini bus which will seat another 15 .
The 50-50 venture will focus on making passenger jets seating between 70 and 115 people , with assembly work performed in both Taiwan and Britain .
The Arab Theatre was a barn-like building which on its better days could seat an audience of two hundred .
The Webster Room , which can seat around 60 , is used for art exhibitions , talks , seminars and group meetings .
This enormous , modern version of a traditional Chinese building , with sweeping blue tile roofs , contains an auditorium big enough to seat 4,700 people .
